result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillan L. Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant must pay costs within 60 days.  If unable to pay within 60 days, Defendant may seek a payment plan with the Clerk of Court.

1 year after the costs in this case have been paid, the Defendant shall be eligible for expungement per 973.015.  Defendant must follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.  The case will not be expungement automatically without the Defendant's follow up with the Clerk.
With work release/huber and stayed until on or before December 4, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: RCSD dispo sheet - "time served"
RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Defendant Dillan L. Hardy in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. L states the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby charge will be amended to disorderly conduct and def will plead to that charge for a jail and costs dispo with possibility of expungement after 1 year and full payment of costs.  Court allows the amendment.  Def pleads no contest to the charge as amended.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel address the Court.

Sentence:  12 days jail with work release/huber, costs, expungement one year after the costs are paid assuming def has no further criminal charges against him.  Court stays the jail for 30 days - jail to begin on or before 12/4 between 6-7 a.m.  60 dtp the costs.
Status conference at 11-04-2015 09:00 am

2:35 p.m.  Defendant Dillan L. Hardy in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def has turned himself in on warrant in this matter.  Court quashes the warrant.  Atty. L requests further status.  Court sets 11/4 at 9.  Court orders previous bond reinstated.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
